intro: Galeopsis bertetii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered a weed in some agricultural contexts.
